Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TBHIV_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Simulation_Duration.description: Elapsed time noted in days from the start to the end of a simulation.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Start_Time.description: Time noted in days when the simulation begins. This time influences the point in the temporal input data, such as where in the climate input EMOD starts running the simulation. Note: The Start_Day of campaign events is in absolute time. So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Config_Name.description: The optional, user-supplied title naming a configuration.

Enable_Demographics_Builtin.description: Controls whether or not built-in demographics for default geography will be used. Note that the built-in demographics feature does not represent a real geographical location and is mostly used for testing.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation. For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration.  Note: VARIABLE_RATE_MIGRATION and LEVY FLIGHTS are currently not supported.

Enable_Interventions.description: Controls whether or not campaign interventions will be used in the simulation.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Controls whether or not individuals experience heterogeneous disease transmission within a node.

Number_Basestrains.description: The number of base strains in the simulation, such as antigenic variants.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: The list of time steps after which to save the serialized state to file. 0 indicates the initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step. The serialized population files can then be loaded at the beginning of a simulation using Serialized_Population_Filenames and Serialized_Population_Path.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for the serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: An array of filenames with serialized population data. The number of filenames must match the number of cores used for the simulation.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TBHIV_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Enable_Interventions.description: Controls whether or not campaign interventions will be used in the simulation.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Controls whether or not individuals experience heterogeneous disease transmission within a node.

Number_Basestrains.description: The number of base strains in the simulation, such as antigenic variants.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Egg_Hatch_Delay_Distribution.description: The distribution of the delay from oviposition to egg hatching.

Egg_Saturation_At_Oviposition.description: If laying all eggs from ovipositing females would overflow the larval habitat capacity on a given day, the means by which the viable eggs become saturated.

Larval_Density_Dependence.description: The funtional form of mortality and growth delay for mosquito larvae based on population density.

Egg_Hatch_Density_Dependence.description: The effect of larval density on egg hatching rate.

Vector_Sugar_Feeding_Frequency.description: The frequency of sugar feeding by a female mosquito. Used in used in conjunction with the SugarTrap and OvipositionTrap interventions. Vector_Sampling_Type must be set to TRACK_ALL_VECTORS or SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS.

Vector_Larval_Rainfall_Mortality.description: Type of vector larval mortality function due to rainfall.

Larval_Rainfall_Mortality_Threshold.description: The threshold value on daily rainfall in millimeters, above which larval mortality is applied.

Enable_Temperature_Dependent_Egg_Hatchin.description: Controls whether or not temperature has an effect on egg hatching, defined by Egg_Arrhenius_1 and Egg_Arrhenius_2.

Egg_Arrhenius1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for egg hatching rate.

Egg_Arrhenius2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for egg hatching rate.

Enable_Egg_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not to include a daily mortality rate on the egg population, which is independent of climatic factors.

Enable_Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Controls whether or not eggs hatch at delayed rates, set by Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay, when the habitat dries up completely.

Drought_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: Proportion of regular egg hatching that still occurs when habitat dries up.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Scalar.description: A scale factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality.

Larval_Density_Mortality_Offset.description: An offset factor in the formula determining the larval-age-dependent mortality.

HEG_Model.description: An enum governing the homing endonuclease gene (HEG) dynamics.

HEG_Homing_Rate.description: The fractional redistribution from heterozygous offspring to the homozygous homing-endonuclease-gene (HEG) behavior.

HEG_Fecundity_Limiting.description: The fractional reduction in the number of eggs laid by a female mosquito who is homozygous in the homing endonuclease gene (HEG).

Enable_Vector_Aging.description: Controls whether or not vectors undergo senescence as they age.

Temperature_Dependent_Feeding_Cycle.description: Effect of temperature on the duration between blood feeds.

Mean_Egg_Hatch_Delay.description: The mean delay in egg hatch time, in days, from the time of oviposition.

Wolbachia_Mortality_Modification.description: The change in vector mortality due to a Wolbachia infection.

Wolbachia_Infection_Modification.description: The change in vector susceptibility to infection due to a Wolbachia infection.

Human_Feeding_Mortality.description: The fraction of mosquitoes, for all species, that die while feeding on a human.

Temporary_Habitat_Decay_Factor.description: Factor to convert raw evaporation rate (ignoring boundary layer effects) to the daily rate of larval habitat loss for temporary habitats (Larval_Habitat_Types set to TEMPORARY_RAINFALL). Units are (larval carrying capacity per day) / (kg per square meter per second).

Semipermanent_Habitat_Decay_Rate.description: Daily rate of larval habitat loss for semi-permanent habitats with Larval_Habitat_Types parameter value of WATER_VEGETATION or BRACKISH_SWAMP.

Rainfall_In_mm_To_Fill_Swamp.description: Millimeters of rain to fill larval habitat to capacity. Only used for vector species with Larval_Habitat_Types set to BRACKISH_SWAMP.

x_Temporary_Larval_Habitat.description: Scale factor for the habitat size for all mosquito populations.

Vector_Species_Names.description: An array of vector species names for all species that are present in the simulation.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: The list of time steps after which to save the serialized state to file. 0 indicates the initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step. The serialized population files can then be loaded at the beginning of a simulation using Serialized_Population_Filenames and Serialized_Population_Path.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for the serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: An array of filenames with serialized population data. The number of filenames must match the number of cores used for the simulation.

Larval_Habitat_Types.description: A measure of the habitat type and scale factors used to estimate larval population. You can specify a habitat type with a simple number scale factor or, for LINEAR_SPINE, with a more detailed scaling configuration.  See the documentation for more information.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for development rate as vectors progress from egg-hatching to emergence.

Aquatic_Arrhenius_2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for development rate as vectors progress from egg-hatching to emergence.

Infected_Arrhenius_1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for sporogony as vectors progress from infected status to infectious.

Infected_Arrhenius_2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for sporogony as vectors progress from infected status to infectious.

Cycle_Arrhenius_1.description: The temperature-independent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for feeding cycle rate.

Cycle_Arrhenius_2.description: The temperature-dependent scale factor in the Arrhenius equation for feeding cycle rate.

Cycle_Arrhenius_Reduction_Factor.description: The scale factor applied to cycle duration (from oviposition to oviposition) to reduce the duration when primary follicles are at stage II rather than I in the case of newly emerged females.

Immature_Duration.description: The number of days for larvae to develop into adult mosquitoes. The value is used to calculate mosquito development rate, which equals 1 / (value of this parameter). Note that development from immature individual to adult is not dependent on temperature.

Days_Between_Feeds.description: Factor (in days) used to calculate the daily rate, 1 / (value of this parameter), at which female mosquitoes attempt to feed.  The Days_Between_Feeds parameter represents a 3-day feeding cycle at normal tropical temperatures (30 C) 4 days at 24 C, and an increase in the fraction of 2-day cycles from 30 C to 48 C.

Anthropophily.description: Propensity of the mosquito to feed on humans instead of animals, measured as a fraction of blood meals from human hosts.

Egg_Batch_Size.description: Size of egg batch laid by one female mosquito that has fed successfully.

Infected_Egg_Batch_Factor.description: The dimensionless factor used to modify mosquito egg batch size  in order to account for reduced fertility effects arising due to infection (e.g. when females undergo sporogony).

Aquatic_Mortality_Rate.description: The base aquatic mortality per day for the species before adjusting for effects of overpopulation and drying out of aquatic habitat.

Adult_Life_Expectancy.description: The number of days an adult mosquito survives. The daily adult mortality rate is 1 / (value of this parameter).

Transmission_Rate.description: Probability that the bite of an infected mosquito establishes a new infection in an immunologically naive and uninfected individual, or the modifier of the probability of success for an individual with pre-erythrocytic immunity.

Acquire_Modifier.description: Modifier of the probability of successful infection of a mosquito by a malaria-infected individual, given the individual's infectiousness.

Infectious_Human_Feed_Mortality_Factor.description: The (dimensionless) factor used to modify the death rate of mosquitoes when feeding on humans, to account for the higher mortality rate infected mosquitoes experience during human feeds versus uninfected mosquitoes.

Indoor_Feeding_Fraction.description: The fraction (dimensionless) of feeds in which mosquitoes feed on humans indoors; the fraction of feeds on humans that occur outdoors equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Nighttime_Feeding_Fraction.description: Fraction of feeds on humans that occur during the nighttime. Thus the fraction of feeds on humans that occur during the day equals 1 - (value of this parameter).

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TBHIV_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

PKPD_Model.description: The pharmacokinetic pharmacodynamic model to use.

Falciparum_MSP_Variants.description: The number of distinct MSP variants for P. falciparum malaria in the overall parasite population in the simulation, not necessarily in an individual.

Falciparum_Nonspecific_Types.description: The number of distinct non-specific types of P. falciparum malaria.

Falciparum_PfEMP1_Variants.description: The number of distinct PfEMP1 variants for P. falciparum malaria in the overall parasite population in the simulation.

Fever_Detection_Threshold.description: Level of body temperature above normal (37 C), corresponding to detectable fever.

Parasite_Smear_Sensitivity.description: The number of microliters of blood tested to find single parasites in a traditional smear (corresponds to inverse parasites/microliters sensitivity).

New_Diagnostic_Sensitivity.description: The number of microliters of blood tested to find single parasites in a new diagnostic (corresponds to inverse parasites/microliters sensitivity).

Genome_Markers.description: A list of the names (strings) of genome marker(s) that represent the genetic components in a strain of an infection.

Max_Drug_IRBC_Kill.description: Maximum log reduction in IRBCs per day due to treatment.

Drug_Hepatocyte_Killrate.description: The log reduction in hepatocytes per day.

Drug_Gametocyte02_Killrate.description: The log reduction per day in early-stage gametocytes.

Drug_Gametocyte34_Killrate.description: The log reduction per day in late-stage gametocytes.

Drug_GametocyteM_Killrate.description: The log reduction per day in mature gametocytes at saturated drug concentration.

Drug_PKPD_C50.description: The concentration at which drug killing rates are half of maximum.

Drug_Vd.description: The volume of drug distribution in a pharmacokinetic two compartment model. This value is the ratio of the volume of the second compartment to that of the first.

Drug_Decay_T1.description: The primary drug decay rate, in days.

Drug_Decay_T2.description: The secondary drug decay rate, in days.

Drug_Fulltreatment_Doses.description: The number of doses for a full treatment.

Drug_Dose_Interval.description: The interval between doses, in days.

Bodyweight_Exponent.description: Effect of body weight on maximum drug concentration in an individual patient.

Upper_Age_In_Years.description: The age, in years, below which children are given a fraction of the adult drug dose, as defined in Fraction_Of_Adult_Dose.

Fraction_Of_Adult_Dose.description: The fraction of the adult drug dose given to children below the age defined in Upper_Age_In_Years.

Fractional_Dose_By_Upper_Age.description: The fraction of the adult drug dose given to children below the age defined in Upper_Age_In_Years.

TBHIV_Drug_Types.description: The list of drug types that will be used with the AntiTBPropDepDrug intervention. The values for the drug are defined by TB_Drug_Params.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: The list of time steps after which to save the serialized state to file. 0 indicates the initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step. TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate.description: The daily rate at which treatment with an anti-TB drug causes inactivation in an individual with drug-sensitive TB.

TB_Drug_Cure_Rate.description: The daily probability of TB cure in an individual with drug-sensitive TB under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Resistance_Rate.description: The daily probability that an individual with drug-sensitive TB will acquire MDR-TB under drug treatment. Only individuals who return to the latent state or fail can acquire MDR-TB.

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate.description: The daily probability of TB inactivation and subsequent relapse in an individual with drug-sensitive TB under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate.description: The daily rate at which treatment with an anti-TB drug causes death  in an individual with drug-sensitive TB.

TB_Drug_Primary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The number of days before the efficacy of a specific anti-TB drug begins to decay.

TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate_HIV.description: The daily probability of active drug-sensitive TB infection becoming latent in an HIV+ person, not currently on ART, under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate_MDR.description: The daily probability of active MDR infection becoming latent in an HIV+ or HIV-  person under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Cure_Rate_HIV.description: The daily probability of active TB infection being cured in an HIV+ person under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Cure_Rate_MDR.description: The daily probability of active MDR infection being cured in an HIV+ or HIV- person under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Resistance_Rate_HIV.description: The daily probability that an (HIV+) individual with drug-sensitive TB will acquire MDR-TB under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate_MDR.description: The daily probability that an active MDR-TB infection (in HIV+ or HIV-) will inactivate but subsequently relapse under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate_HIV.description: The daily probability that a drug-sensitive active infection in an HIV+ individual not currently on ART will inactivate but subsequently relapse under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate_MDR.description: The daily probability of death for individual with MDR active infection under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate_HIV.description: The daily probability of death for HIV+ individual with drug sensitive active infection under drug treatment.

TB_Reduced_Transmit.description: Proportion reduction in TB transmission under drug treatment.

TB_Reduced_Acquire.description: Proportion reduction in acquisition of new TB infection under drug treatment.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TBHIV_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Simulation_Duration.description: Elapsed time noted in days from the start to the end of a simulation.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Start_Time.description: Time noted in days when the simulation begins. This time influences the point in the temporal input data, such as where in the climate input EMOD starts running the simulation. Note: The Start_Day of campaign events is in absolute time. So, time relative to the beginning of the simulation depends on this parameter.

Config_Name.description: The optional, user-supplied title naming a configuration.

Enable_Demographics_Builtin.description: Controls whether or not built-in demographics for default geography will be used. Note that the built-in demographics feature does not represent a real geographical location and is mostly used for testing.

Default_Geography_Initial_Node_Populatio.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the initial number of individuals in each node.

Default_Geography_Torus_Size.description: When using the built-in demographics for default geography, the square root of the number of nodes in the simulation. For migration, the nodes are assumed to be a torus.

Node_Grid_Size.description: Spatial resolution indicating the node grid size for a simulation in degrees.

Migration_Model.description: Model to use for migration.  Note: VARIABLE_RATE_MIGRATION and LEVY FLIGHTS are currently not supported.

Enable_Interventions.description: Controls whether or not campaign interventions will be used in the simulation.

Enable_Heterogeneous_Intranode_Transmiss.description: Controls whether or not individuals experience heterogeneous disease transmission within a node.

Number_Basestrains.description: The number of base strains in the simulation, such as antigenic variants.

Number_Substrains.description: The number of disease substrains for each base strain, such as genetic variants.

Serialization_Time_Steps.description: The list of time steps after which to save the serialized state to file. 0 indicates the initial state before simulation, n indicates after the nth time step. The serialized population files can then be loaded at the beginning of a simulation using Serialized_Population_Filenames and Serialized_Population_Path.

Serialized_Population_Path.description: Root path for the serialized population files.

Serialized_Population_Filenames.description: An array of filenames with serialized population data. The number of filenames must match the number of cores used for the simulation.

Simulation_Type.description: Type of disease being simulated. IDM-supported values include GENERIC_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, MALARIA_SIM, TBHIV_SIM, STI_SIM, and HIV_SIM. To query the values supported for your specific build, use the --version option.

Simulation_Timestep.description: Value indicating simulation time step in days.

Air_Temperature_Offset.description: The linear shift of air temperature in degrees Celsius.

Land_Temperature_Offset.description: The linear shift of land surface temperature in degrees Celsius.

Rainfall_Scale_Factor.description: The scale factor used in multiplying rainfall value(s).

Relative_Humidity_Scale_Factor.description: The scale factor used in multiplying relative humidity values.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not the climate has stochasticity.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not there is stochastic variation in rainfall.

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Base_Air_Temperature.description: The air temperature, in degrees Celsius, where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Land_Temperature.description: The land temperature, in degrees Celsius, where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Rainfall.description: The value of rainfall per day in millimeters when Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Base_Relative_Humidity.description: The value of humidity where Climate_Model is set to CLIMATE_CONSTANT.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not the climate has stochasticity.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not there is stochastic variation in rainfall.

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Climate_Model.description: How and from what files the climate of a simulation is configured.

Climate_Update_Resolution.description: The resolution for data in climate files.

Air_Temperature_Filename.description: The path to the input data file defining air temperature data measured 2 meters above ground.

Land_Temperature_Filename.description: Path of input file defining temperature data measured at land surface.

Rainfall_Filename.description: Path of input file defining rainfall data.

Relative_Humidity_Filename.description: Path of input file defining relative humidity data measured 2 meters above ground.

Koppen_Filename.description: Path to input file used to specify Koppen climate classifications.

Enable_Climate_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not the climate has stochasticity.

Air_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily air temperature values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Land_Temperature_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in degrees Celsius) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily land temperature values.

Enable_Rainfall_Stochasticity.description: Controls whether or not there is stochastic variation in rainfall.

Relative_Humidity_Variance.description: The standard deviation (in percentage) for normally distributed noise applied to the daily relative humidity values when Climate_Model is configured as CLIMATE_CONSTANT or CLIMATE_BY_DATA.

Listed_Events.description: The list of valid, user-defined events that will be included in the campaign. Any event used in the campaign must either be one of the built-in events or in this list.

HIV_Child_Survival_Rapid_Progressor_Rate.description: The exponential decay rate, in years, describing the distribution of HIV survival for children who are rapid progressors.

HIV_Child_Survival_Slow_Progressor_Shape.description: The Weibull shape parameter describing the distribution of HIV survival for children who are slower progressors.

HIV_Child_Survival_Slow_Progressor_Scale.description: The Weibull scale parameter describing the distribution of HIV survival for children who are slower progressors.

HIV_Child_Survival_Rapid_Progressor_Frac.description: The proportion of HIV-infected children who are rapid HIV progressors.

HIV_Age_Max_for_Child_Survival_Function.description: The maximum age at which an individual's survival will be fit to the child survival function. If the value of this parameter falls between zero and the age of sexual debut, model results are not sensitive to this parameter.

HIV_Age_Max_for_Adult_Age_Dependent_Surv.description: Determines the age beyond which HIV survival is no longer affected by further aging.

HIV_Adult_Survival_Scale_Parameter_Slope.description: Determines the slope of the scale parameter, ?, for the Weibull distribution used to determine HIV survival time; should be set to a negative number.

HIV_Adult_Survival_Scale_Parameter_Inter.description: Determines the intercept of the scale parameter, ?, for the Weibull distribution used to determine HIV survival time.

HIV_Adult_Survival_Shape_Parameter.description: This parameter determines the shape of the Weibull distribution used to determine age-dependent survival time for individuals infected with HIV.

Acute_Duration_In_Months.description: The time since infection, in months, over which the Acute_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier is applied to coital acts occurring in that time period.

AIDS_Duration_In_Months.description: The length of time, in months, prior to an AIDS-related death over which the AIDS_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier is applied.

Acute_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier.description: The multiplier acting on Base_Infectivity to determine the per-act transmission probability of an HIV+ individual during the acute stage.

AIDS_Stage_Infectivity_Multiplier.description: The multiplier acting on Base_Infectivity to determine the per-act transmission probability of an HIV+ individual during the AIDS stage.

ART_Viral_Suppression_Multiplier.description: Multiplier acting on Base_Infectivity to determine the per-act transmission probability of a virally suppressed HIV+ individual.

Heterogeneous_Infectiousness_LogNormal_S.description: Scale parameter of a log normal distribution that governs an infectiousness multiplier. The multiplier represents heterogeneity in infectivity and adjusts Base_Infectivity.

ART_CD4_at_Initiation_Saturating_Reducti.description: The duration from ART enrollment to on-ART HIV-cause death increases with CD4 at ART initiation up to a threshold determined by this parameter value.

CD4_Post_Infection_Weibull_Scale.description: The scale parameter of a Weibull distribution that represents the post-acute-infection CD4 cell count.

CD4_Post_Infection_Weibull_Heterogeneity.description: The inverse shape parameter of a Weibull distribution that represents the post-acute-infection CD4 cell count.

CD4_At_Death_LogLogistic_Scale.description: The scale parameter of a Weibull distribution that represents the at-death CD4 cell count.

CD4_At_Death_LogLogistic_Heterogeneity.description: The inverse shape parameter of a Weibull distribution that represents the at-death CD4 cell count.

Days_Between_Symptomatic_And_Death_Weibu.description: The time between onset of AIDS symptoms and death is sampled from a Weibull distribution. This parameter governs the scale of the Weibull.
The time between onset of AIDS symptoms and death is sampled from a Weibull distribution. This parameter governs the heterogeneity (inverse shape) of the Weibull.

CD4_Num_Steps.description: The number of time steps in CD4 forward vector for reactivation.

CD4_Time_Step.description: The length of steps in the CD4 longitudinal tracker.

Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_L.description: If set to 0, only the events listed in the Report_Event_Recorder_Events array will be included in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report. If set to 1, only the events listed in the array will be excluded, and all other events will be included. If you want to return all events from the simulation, leave the events array empty.

Report_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report, based on how Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_List is set.

Report_Event_Recorder_Individual_Propert.description: A list of the IndividualProperty key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention.

Enable_Aging.description: Controls whether or not individuals in a population age during the simulation.

Infection_Updates_Per_Timestep.description: Number of infection updates executed during each timestep. A timestep defaults to one day.

Enable_Immunity.description: Controls whether or not an individual has protective immunity after an infection clears.

Enable_Superinfection.description: Controls whether or not an individual can have multiple infections simultaneously.

Max_Individual_Infections.description: Limit on the number of infections that an individual can have simultaneously.

Minimum_Adult_Age_Years.description: The age, in years, after which an individual is considered an adult.

Enable_Skipping.description: Controls whether or not the simulation uses an optimization that can increase performance by up to 50% in some cases by probablistically exposing individuals rather than exposing every single person. Useful in low-prevalence, high-population scenarios

Migration_Pattern.description: The type of migration pattern used for the trip. For example, a single roundtrip.

Local_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who walks into a neighboring node will return to the node of origin during the next migration.

Air_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: The likelihood that an individual who flies to another node will return to the node of origin during the next migration.

Regional_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who travels by vehicle to another node will return to the node of origin during the next migration.

Sea_Migration_Roundtrip_Probability.description: Likelihood that an individual who travels by ship into a neighboring node will return to the node of origin during the next migration. Used only when Enable_Sea_Migration is set to 1.

Local_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by foot travel.

Air_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by airplane.

Regional_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by road network.

Sea_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The average time spent at the destination node during a round-trip migration by ship.

Family_Migration_Roundtrip_Duration.description: The number of days to complete the trip and return to the original node.

Roundtrip_Waypoints.description: The maximum number of points reached during a trip before steps are retraced on the return trip home.

Maternal_Transmission_ART_Multiplier.description: Maternal transmission multiplier for on-ART mothers.

Sexual_Debut_Age_Male_Weibull_Heterogene.description: Inverse shape of Weibull for male debut age.

Sexual_Debut_Age_Male_Weibull_Scale.description: Scale of Weibull for male debut age.

Sexual_Debut_Age_Female_Weibull_Heteroge.description: Inverse shape of Weibull for female debut age.

Sexual_Debut_Age_Female_Weibull_Scale.description: Scale of Weibull for female debut age.

STI_Coinfection_Acquisition_Multiplier.description: Per-act HIV acquisition probability multiplier for individuals with the STI coinfection flag.

STI_Coinfection_Transmission_Multiplier.description: Per-act HIV transmission probability multiplier for individuals with the STI coinfection flag.

Min_Days_Between_Adding_Relationships.description: Minimum number of days between adding two consecutive relationships as a means to control concurrency.  The constraint does not apply if an individual breaks an existing relationship.

Male_To_Female_Relative_Infectivity_Ages.description: Vector of ages governing the susceptibility of females relative to males, by age. Used with Male_To_Female_Relative_Infectivity_Multipliers.

Male_To_Female_Relative_Infectivity_Mult.description: Array of scale factors governing the susceptibility of females relative to males, by age. Used with Male_To_Female_Relative_Infectivity_Ages. Scaling is linearly interpolated between ages. The first value is used for individuals younger than the first age in Male_To_Female_Relative_Infectivity_Ages and the last value is used for individuals older than the last age.

Condom_Transmission_Blocking_Probability.description: The per-act multiplier of the transmission probability when a condom is used.

Enable_Coital_Dilution.description: Controls whether or not coital dilution will occur.

Coital_Dilution_Factor_2_Partners.description: The multiplicative reduction in the coital act rate for all relationship types when an individual has exactly two current partners. Represents coital dilution.

Coital_Dilution_Factor_3_Partners.description: The multiplicative reduction in the coital act rate for all relationship types when an individual has exactly three current partners. Represents coital dilution.

Coital_Dilution_Factor_4_Plus_Partners.description: The multiplicative reduction in the coital act rate for all relationship types when an individual has four or more current partners. Represents coital dilution.

Enable_Disease_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not individuals are removed from the simulation due to disease deaths.

Mortality_Time_Course.description: The method used to calculate disease deaths: on every time step or once at the end of the disease duration.

Base_Mortality.description: The base mortality of the infection before accounting for individual immune modification factors. Depending on the setting of Mortality_Time_Course, this is either the daily probability of the disease being fatal (DAILY_MORTALITY) or the probability of death at the end of the infection duration (MORTALITY_AFTER_INFECTIOUS).

Base_Infectivity.description: The base infectiousness of individuals before accounting for transmission-blocking effects of acquired immunity and/or campaign interventions. It has a slightly different meaning for each of the disease types.

Incubation_Period_Distribution.description: Distribution for the duration of the incubation period.

Incubation_Period_Min.description: The minimum length of the incubation period.

Incubation_Period_Max.description: The maximum length of the incubation period.

Incubation_Period_Mean.description: The mean of the incubation period. Incubation_Period_Distribution must be set to either GAUSSIAN_DURATION or POISSON_DURATION.

Incubation_Period_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation of the incubation period.

Base_Incubation_Period.description: Average duration, in days, of the incubation period before infected individuals becomes infectious.

Incubation_Period_Log_Mean.description: The mean of log normal for the incubation period distribution.

Incubation_Period_Log_Width.description: The log width of log normal for the incubation period distribution.

Infectious_Period_Distribution.description: Distribution of duration of infectious period.

depends-on.Simulation_Type: GENERIC_SIM, POLIO_SIM, VECTOR_SIM, ENVIRONMENTAL_SIM, PY_SIM, STI_SIM

Base_Infectious_Period.description: Average duration, in days, of the infectious period before the infection is cleared.

Infectious_Period_Min.description: The minimum length of the infectious period.

Infectious_Period_Max.description: The maximum length of the infectious period.

Infectious_Period_Mean.description: The mean of the infectious period.

Infectious_Period_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation of the infectious period.

Malaria_Model.description: The type of malaria model used in a simulation.

Mean_Sporozoites_Per_Bite.description: Mean number of sporozoites per infectious mosquito bite.

Base_Sporozoite_Survival_Fraction.description: Fraction of sporozoites that survive to infect a hepatocyte in the absence of anti-CSP protection.

Antibody_CSP_Killing_Threshold.description: Threshold value on CSP antibody concentration for sporozoite killing.

Antibody_CSP_Killing_Inverse_Width.description: Inverse width of sigmoidal sporozoite killing function of CSP antibody concentration.

Malaria_Strain_Model.description: The generator that is used to construct the antigenic repertoire of a malaria infection.

Parasite_Switch_Type.description: Parasite switch type for erythrocyte surface antigens.

Antibody_IRBC_Kill_Rate.description: The scale factor multiplied by antibody level to produce the rate of clearance of the infected red blood cell (IRBC) population.

Nonspecific_Antigenicity_Factor.description: Nonspecific antigenicity factor that adjusts antibody IRBC kill rate to account for IRBCs caused by antibody responses to antigenically weak surface proteins.

MSP1_Merozoite_Kill_Fraction.description: Fraction of merozoites inhibited from invading new erythrocytes when MSP1-specific antibody level is 1.

Gametocyte_Stage_Survival_Rate.description: The rate of gametocyte survival from one development stage to the next in the absence of drugs or inflammatory immune response.

Base_Gametocyte_Fraction_Male.description: Fraction of gametocytes that are male.

Antigen_Switch_Rate.description: The antigenic switching rate per infected red blood cell per asexual cycle.

Merozoites_Per_Hepatocyte.description: Number of IRBCs caused by a single infected hepatocyte at the start of infection.

Merozoites_Per_Schizont.description: Number of merozoites released by a single infected schizont after each asexual cycle. The number of resulting IRBC's depends on the RBC availability and merozoite-specific immunity.

RBC_Destruction_Multiplier.description: Number of total RBCs destroyed per infected rupturing schizont.

Number_Of_Asexual_Cycles_Without_Gametoc.description: Number of asexual reproduction cycles that do not produce gametocytes. All later cycles will produce gametocytes according to Base_Gametocyte_Production_Rate.

Anemia_Mortality_Threshold.description: The threshold value for hemoglobin count in grams per deciliter (g/dL) at which 50% of individuals die per day.

Parasite_Mortality_Threshold.description: The parasite-density mortality threshold for a simulation.

Fever_Mortality_Threshold.description: The fever mortality threshold, in units of degrees Celsius above normal body temperature (defined as 37 C); sets the midpoint in the sigmoidal response for mortality rate associated with fever.

Enable_Sexual_Combination.description: Controls whether or not male and female gametocytes undergo sexual combination. Note: This parameter is currently not in use.

Base_Gametocyte_Mosquito_Survival_Rate.description: Average fraction of gametocytes in a blood meal that are successful in infecting the mosquito in the absence of other modulating effects, such as fever.

Cytokine_Gametocyte_Inactivation.description: The strength of inflammatory response inactivation of gametocytes.

Anemia_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for anemia.

Parasite_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of mortality turn-on around threshold for parasite density.

Fever_Mortality_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of mortality turn-on around threshold for fever.

Anemia_Severe_Threshold.description: The severe disease threshold level for anemia. Threshold units are in grams per deciliter (g/dL).

Parasite_Severe_Threshold.description: The severe disease threshold level for parasite density.

Fever_Severe_Threshold.description: The threshold (in degrees Celsius above normal) for fever indicating severe disease.

Anemia_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for anemia.

Parasite_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for parasite density.

Fever_Severe_Inverse_Width.description: The inverse width relative to threshold value of severe disease turn-on around threshold for fever.

Clinical_Fever_Threshold_Low.description: The fever threshold (in degrees Celsius above normal) to end a clinical incident.

Clinical_Fever_Threshold_High.description: The fever threshold (in degrees Celsius above normal) to start a clinical incident.

Min_Days_Between_Clinical_Incidents.description: The number of days with fever below the low threshold before a new incident can start when the high fever threshold is again exceeded.

Antibody_Memory_Level.description: The limiting level of antibody capacity that remains after a prolonged absence of a specific antigen. The antibody capacity decays to this level gradually after infection is cleared.

Max_MSP1_Antibody_Growthrate.description: Maximum increase in MSP1 antibody capacity during each asexual cycle. The higher this value, the sooner early clearances are observed and the earlier the parasite density envelope decreases.

Antibody_Stimulation_C50.description: The concentration of an antigen, measured in IRBC/ul at which growth in antibody capacity against the antigen increases at half the maximum rate specified by Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate.

Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate.description: The maximum daily rate of specific antibody capacity increase.

Min_Adapted_Response.description: Minimum level of antibody stimulation to novel antigen. The value sets the low-range asymptote for antibody capacity growth, which is calculated from Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate and antigen density, in the presence of any nonzero antigen level.

Nonspecific_Antibody_Growth_Rate_Factor.description: Factor that adjusts Antibody_Capacity_Growth_Rate for less immunogenic surface proteins called the minor epitopes.

Antibody_CSP_Decay_Days.description: Exponential decay time for CSP antibody concentration (in days).

Erythropoiesis_Anemia_Effect.description: The exponential rate of increased red-blood-cell production from reduced red-blood-cell availability.

Enable_Maternal_Antibodies_Transmission.description: Controls whether or not mothers pass antibodies to their infants.

Maternal_Antibody_Protection.description: Strength of protection from maternal antibodies as a multiple of full antibody killing effect.

Maternal_Antibody_Decay_Rate.description: Decay rate per day in protection from maternal antibodies.

Innate_Immune_Variation_Type.description: The type of innate immunity on which to apply individual-level variation.

Pyrogenic_Threshold.description: Level of bloodstream infection, measured in IRBC per microliter, at which stimulation of the innate inflammatory immune response is half its maximum value.

Fever_IRBC_Kill_Rate.description: The maximum kill rate for infected red blood cells due to the inflammatory innate immune response. As fever increases above 38.5 degrees Celsius, the kill rate becomes successively higher along a sigmoidal curve approaching this rate.

Memory_Usage_Warning_Threshold_Working_S.description: The maximum size of working set memory before memory usage statistics are written to the log regardless of log level.

Memory_Usage_Halting_Threshold_Working_S.description: The maximum size of working set memory before the system throws an exception and halts.

x_Local_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by foot travel.

Enable_Migration_Heterogeneity.description: Controls whether or not migration rate is heterogeneous among individuals.

Enable_Local_Migration.description: Controls whether or not local migration (the diffusion of people in and out of nearby nodes by foot travel) occurs.

Enable_Air_Migration.description: Controls whether or not migration by air travel will occur.

Enable_Regional_Migration.description: Controls whether or not there is migration by road vehicle into and out of nodes in the road network.

Enable_Sea_Migration.description: Controls whether or not there is migration on ships into and out of coastal cities with seaports.

Enable_Family_Migration.description: Controls whether or not all members of a household can migrate together when an MigrateFamily event occurs. All residents must be home before they can leave on the trip.

Local_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration to adjacent nodes by foot travel.

Air_Migration_Filename.description: The path to the input data file defining patterns of migration by airplane.

Regional_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by vehicle via road or rail network. If the node is not on a road or rail network, regional migration focuses on the closest hub city in the network.

Sea_Migration_Filename.description: Path of input file defining patterns of migration by ship.

Family_Migration_Filename.description: The name of the binary file to use to configure family migration.

x_Local_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by foot travel.

x_Air_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by air.

x_Regional_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by road vehicle.

x_Sea_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by sea.

x_Family_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by families.

x_Family_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by families.

Enable_Vector_Migration.description: Controls whether or not vectors can migrate. Vector_Sampling_Type must be set to  TRACK_ALL_VECTORS or SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS.

Vector_Migration_Modifier_Equation.description: Functional form of vector migration modifiers.

Enable_Vector_Migration_Local.description: Controls whether or not vectors may migrate to adjacent nodes.

Enable_Vector_Migration_Regional.description: Controls whether or not vectors can migration to non-adjacent nodes.

Vector_Migration_Filename_Local.description: Path to the vector migration file defining patterns of vector migration to adjacent nodes.

Vector_Migration_Filename_Regional.description: Path to the vector migration file defining patterns of vector migration to non-adjacent nodes.

x_Vector_Migration_Local.description: Scale factor for the rate of vector migration to adjacent nodes.

x_Vector_Migration_Regional.description: Scale factor for the rate of vector migration to non-adjacent nodes.

Vector_Migration_Habitat_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to migrate toward a node with more habitat. Only relevant when Vector_Sampling_Type is set to TRACK_ALL_VECTORS.

Vector_Migration_Food_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to migrate toward a node currently occupied by humans, independent of the number of humans in the node. Only relevant when Vector_Sampling_Type is set to TRACK_ALL_VECTORS.

Vector_Migration_Stay_Put_Modifier.description: Preference of a vector to remain in its current node rather than migrate to another node. Only relevant when Vector_Sampling_Type is set to TRACK_ALL_VECTORS.

x_Local_Migration.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by foot travel.

Enable_Vector_Migration.description: Controls whether or not vectors can migrate. Vector_Sampling_Type must be set to  TRACK_ALL_VECTORS or SAMPLE_IND_VECTORS.

x_Vector_Migration_Local.description: Scale factor for the rate of migration by foot travel.

Enable_Vital_Dynamics.description: Controls whether or not births and deaths occur in the simulation.

Enable_Natural_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not individuals are removed from the simulation due to natural (non-disease) deaths.

Death_Rate_Dependence.description: Determines how likely individuals are to die from natural, non-disease causes.

Enable_Susceptibility_Scaling.description: Controls whether or not susceptibility is scaled by time as defined by Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Type.description: The effect of time on susceptibility.

Susceptibility_Scaling_Rate.description: The scaling rate for the variation in time of the log-linear susceptibility scaling.

Age_Initialization_Distribution_Type.description: The method for initializing the age distribution in the simulated population.

Infectivity_Scale_Type.description: Alter infectivity by time or season.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the amplitude of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: Only used or needed when Infectivity_Scale_Type is set to SINUSOIDAL_FUNCTION_OF_TIME.  Sets the phase of sinusoidal variations in Base_Infectivity.

Infectivity_Exponential_Baseline.description: The scale factor applied to Base_Infectivity at the beginning of a simulation, before the infectivity begins to grow exponentially.

Infectivity_Exponential_Delay.description: The number of days before infectivity begins to ramp up exponentially.

Infectivity_Exponential_Rate.description: The daily rate of exponential growth to approach full infectivity after the delay set by Infectivity_Exponential_Delay has passed.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in R0 during high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Beginning of high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Infectivity_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: End of high infectivity season when Infectivity_Scale_Type is equal to ANNUAL_BOXCAR_FUNCTION.

Animal_Reservoir_Type.description: The type of animal reservoir and configuration to use for zoonosis.

Zoonosis_Rate.description: The daily rate of zoonotic infection per individual.

x_Other_Mortality.description: Scale factor for mortality from causes other than the disease being simulated.

Enable_Initial_Prevalence.description: Controls whether or not parameters in the demographics file are used to define a distribution for the number of infected people per node at the beginning of the simulation. Set the distribution under IndividualAttributes using PrevalenceDistributionFlag, PrevalenceDistribution1, and PrevalenceDistribution2.

Enable_Birth.description: Controls whether or not individuals will be added to the simulation by birth.

Enable_Demographics_Risk.description: Controls whether or not the simulation includes the impact of disease risk in demographics.

Enable_Demographics_Gender.description: Controls whether or not gender ratios are drawn from a Gaussian distribution or a 50/50 draw. When set to 1 (true), the ratio of males to females is drawn from a Gaussian distribution with a mean of 0.5 and a standard deviation of 0.01. When set to 0 (false), the gender ratio is based on a 50/50 draw.

Enable_Immunity_Distribution.description: Controls whether or not individuals in the population have immunity at the beginning of the simulation. If set to 0, individuals are not initialized with immunity but may acquire immunity. If set to 1, you must indicate the type of distribution to use for immunity in the configuration parameter Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Type and the distribution values in the demographics file.

Enable_Maternal_Infection_Transmission.description: Controls whether or not infectious mothers infect infants at birth.

Maternal_Infection_Transmission_Probabil.description: Probability of transmission of infection from mother to infant at birth. Note: For malaria and vector simulations, set this to 0.

Enable_Demographics_Birth.description: Controls whether or not newborns have identical or heterogeneous characteristics.

Birth_Rate_Dependence.description: The method used to modify the value set in BirthRate in the demographics file.

Individual_Sampling_Type.description: The type of individual human sampling.

Base_Individual_Sample_Rate.description: The base rate of sampling for individuals, equal to the fraction of individuals in each node being sampled.

Relative_Sample_Rate_Immune.description: Relative sampling rate for people who have acquired immunity through recovery or vaccination.

Immune_Threshold_For_Downsampling.description: Threshold on acquisition immunity at which to apply immunity dependent downsampling.

Sample_Rate_Birth.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for births.

Sample_Rate_0_18mo.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for infants age 0 to 18 months.

Sample_Rate_18mo_4yr.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for children age 18 months to 4 years.

Sample_Rate_5_9.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for children age 5 to 9 years.

Sample_Rate_10_14.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for children age 10 to 14 years.

Sample_Rate_15_19.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for adolescents age 15 to 19 years.

Sample_Rate_20_Plus.description: For age-adapted sampling, the relative sampling rate for adults age 20 and older.

Max_Node_Population_Samples.description: The maximum number of individuals to track in a node. When the population exceeds this number, the sampling rate will drop according to the value set in Individual_Sampling_Type.

Population_Scale_Type.description: The method to use for scaling the initial population specified in the demographics input file.

Base_Population_Scale_Factor.description: The scale facor for InitialPopulation in the demographics file.

Population_Density_Infectivity_Correctio.description: Correction to alter infectivity by population density set in the Population_Density_C50 parameter. Measured in people per sq. km. Note: Sparsely populated areas have a lower infectivity, while densely populated areas have a higher infectivity, which rises to saturate at the Base_Infectivity value.

Population_Density_C50.description: The population density at which R0 for a 2.5-arc minute square reaches half of its initial value.

Birth_Rate_Time_Dependence.description: A scale factor that allows the birth rate to be altered by time or season.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Amplitude.description: The amplitude of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Sinusoidal_Forcing_Phase.description: The phase of sinusoidal variations in birth rate.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Amplitude.description: Fractional increase in birth rate during high birth season.

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_Start_Time.description: Day of the year when the high birth rate season begins

Birth_Rate_Boxcar_Forcing_End_Time.description: Day of the year when the high birth rate season ends.

Demographics_Filenames.description: An array of the paths to demographics files containing information on the identity and demographics of the region to simulate.

PFA_Burnin_Duration_In_Days.description: Number of days to continue tuning the pair formation rates.  After this duration, the rates will remain at the last rate value calculated.

Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_L.description: If set to 0, only the events listed in the Report_Event_Recorder_Events array will be included in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report. If set to 1, only the events listed in the array will be excluded, and all other events will be included. If you want to return all events from the simulation, leave the events array empty.

Report_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report, based on how Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_List is set.

Report_Event_Recorder_Individual_Propert.description: A list of the IndividualProperty key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention.

Report_HIV_Event_Channels_List.description: This is the list of events included in the InsetChart report. If events are specified with this parameter, the InsetChart will include a channel for each event listed. If no events are listed, a 'Number of Events' channel will display the total number of all events that occurred during the simulation.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Start_Year.description: The beginning calendar year that will be collected by the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv report.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Stop_Year.description: The ending calendar year that will be collected by the HIVByAgeAndGender.csv report.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_Gender.description: Controls whether or not the report is stratified by gender; to enable gender stratification, set to true (1).

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_Age_Bi.description: This array of floats allows the user to define the age bins used to stratify the report by age. Each value defines the minimum value of that bin, while the next value defines the maximum value of the bin. The maximum number of age bins is 100.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_Circum.description: When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output report will have separate rows for those who do or do not have the MaleCircumcision intervention and an additional column with 0 and 1 indicating whether the row corresponds to those who are or are not circumcised. Setting this to 1 doubles the number of rows in ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_HIV_Da.description: When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output report will have separate rows for those who do or do not have the ART intervention and an additional column with 0 and 1 indicating whether the row corresponds to those who are or are not on ART. Setting this to 1 doubles the number of rows in ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_On_Art.description: Controls whether or not the output report is stratified by those people who are on ART and those who are not. Set to true (1) to enable stratification by ART status.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_IP_Dat.description: When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output report will have separate rows for those with different IndividualProperties values and an additional column for each property indicating which row corresponds to which value of that property. Setting this to 1 typically increases by severalfold the number of rows in ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_Interv.description: Stratifies the population by adding a column of 0s and 1s depending on whether or not the person has the indicated intervention. This only works for interventions that remain with a person for a period of time, such as ART, VMMC, vaccine/PrEP, or a delay state in the cascade of care. You can name the intervention by adding a parameter Intervention_Name in the campaign file, and then give this parameter the same Intervention_Name. This allows you to have multiple types of vaccines, VMMCs, etc., but to only stratify on the type you want.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Add_Transmitte.description: When set to to true (1), the 'transmitters' column is included in the output report.  For a given row, 'Transmitters' indicates how many people that have transmitted the disease meet the specifications of that row.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Stratify_Infec.description: When set to 1, the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output file will separate the count of the number of infected individuals by CD4 stratum. When set to 0, the number of infected individuals are aggregated into one column regardless of CD4 count.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Has_Interventi.description: This parameter is deprecated and has been replaced with Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Collect_Intervention_Data.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Event_Counter_.description: A list of columns to add to the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output files counting the number of times an intervention with the corresponding Distributed_Event_Trigger has been distributed.

Report_HIV_ByAgeAndGender_Add_Relationsh.description: Sets whether or not the ReportHIVByAgeAndGender.csv output file will contain data by relationship type on population currently in a relationship and ever in a relationship.  A sum of those in two or more partnerships and a sum of the lifetime number of relationships in each bin will be included.

Report_HIV_Infection_Start_Year.description: The beginning calendar year that will be collected by the ReportHIVInfection.csv output report.

Report_HIV_Infection_Stop_Year.description: The ending calendar year that will be collected by the ReportHIVInfection.csv output report.

Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_L.description: If set to 0, only the events listed in the Report_Event_Recorder_Events array will be included in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report. If set to 1, only the events listed in the array will be excluded, and all other events will be included. If you want to return all events from the simulation, leave the events array empty.

Report_Event_Recorder_Events.description: The list of events to include or exclude in the ReportEventRecorder.csv output report, based on how Report_Event_Recorder_Ignore_Events_In_List is set.

Report_Event_Recorder_Individual_Propert.description: A list of the IndividualProperty key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention.

PFA_Cum_Prob_Selection_Threshold.description: This parameter serves to minimize the extent to which relationships with unlikely age gaps are formed. These unlikely relationships could be generated due to lack of diversity in the PFA. Within the algorithm, males pick from amongst the available females by age bin, weighted by the conditional of the joint_probability matrix given the male age bin.  If the sum of the probabilities in the female age bins that are not empty is below this threshold, the male will wait till the next update. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the feature.

Spatial_Output_Channels.description: An array of channel names for spatial output by node and time step. The data from each channel will be written to a separate binary file. For full documentation of spatial output channels, please see the online documentation.

Post_Infection_Acquisition_Multiplier.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of reacquiring the disease.

Post_Infection_Transmission_Multiplier.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of transmitting infection after getting re-infected.

Post_Infection_Mortality_Multiplier.description: Multiplicative reduction in probability of dying from infection after getting re-infected.

Enable_Immune_Decay.description: Controls whether or not immunity decays after an infection clears.

Acquisition_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rate.description: The rate at which acquisition-blocking immunity decays after the initial period indicated by the base acquisition-blocking immunity offset.

Transmission_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rat.description: Rate at which transmission-blocking immunity decays after the base transmission-blocking immunity offset period. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Mortality_Blocking_Immunity_Decay_Rate.description: Rate at which mortality-blocking immunity decays after the mortality-blocking immunity offset period.

Acquisition_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_B.description: The number of days after infection until acquisition-blocking immunity begins to decay.

Transmission_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_.description: Number of days after infection until transmission-blocking immunity begins to decay. Relevant only when Enable_Immunity and Enable_Immune_Decay parameters are set to 1.

Mortality_Blocking_Immunity_Duration_Bef.description: Number of days after infection until mortality-blocking immunity begins to decay.

Enable_Maternal_Protection.description: Controls whether or not mothers pass immunity on to their infants. Setting to 1 (true) enables maternal protection as defined by Maternal_Protection_Type.

Maternal_Protection_Type.description: The type of maternal protection afforded to infants.

Maternal_Linear_Slope.description: Slope parameter describing the rate of waning for maternal protection, must be positive. The per-day increase in susceptibility.

Maternal_Linear_SusZero.description: The initial level of maternal protection at age 0, given as susceptibility. A value of 0.0 implies total protection, a value of 1.0 implies no protection.

Maternal_Sigmoid_SteepFac.description: The steepness factor describing the rate of waning for maternal protection, must be positive. Small values imply rapid waning.

Maternal_Sigmoid_HalfMaxAge.description: The age in days that the level of maternal protection is half of its initial value.

Maternal_Sigmoid_SusInit.description: The initial level of maternal protection at age -INF, given as susceptibility. A value of 0.0 implies total protection, a value of 1.0 implies no protection.

Susceptibility_Type.description: Controls implementation of an individual's susceptibility.

Immunity_Initialization_Distribution_Typ.description: The method for initializing the immunity distribution in the simulated population.

TB_Immune_Loss_Fraction.description: The fraction of individuals that lose immunity with time.

TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Child.description: Fraction of active cases in children (under age 15) that are smear-positive. The sum of TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Child and TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Child must be less than or equal to 1.

TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Adult.description: Fraction of active cases in adults (age 15 and over) that are smear-positive. The sum of TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Adult and TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Adult must be less than or equal to 1.

TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Child.description: Fraction of active cases in children (under age 15) that are extrapulmonary. The sum of this and TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Child must be less than or equal to 1.

TB_Extrapulmonary_Fraction_Adult.description: Fraction of active cases in adults (age 15 or over) that are extrapulmonary. The sum of this and TB_Smear_Positive_Fraction_Adult must be less than or equal to 1.

TB_Fast_Progressor_Fraction_Type.description: enable fast progressor fraction by age or social determinants like poverty

TB_Fast_Progressor_Fraction_Child.description: Fraction of children (under age 15) that are fast progressors.

TB_Fast_Progressor_Fraction_Adult.description: Fraction of adults (age 15 or over) that are fast progressors.

TB_Latent_Cure_Rate.description: The mean rate at which individuals progress from a latently infected state to a cured (uninfected) state.

TB_Fast_Progressor_Rate.description: The mean rate at which individuals who are fast progressors progress from a latently infected state to an active presymptomatic state.

TB_Slow_Progressor_Rate.description: The mean rate at which individuals who are slow progressors progress from a latently infected state to an active presymptomatic state.

TB_Active_Cure_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active symptomatic individuals progress to a cured (uninfected) state.

TB_Inactivation_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active symptomatic (smear-positive, smear-negative, and extrapulmonary) individuals progress to an inactivated (latently infected) state.

TB_Active_Mortality_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active smear-positive individuals die from TB disease.

TB_Extrapulmonary_Mortality_Multiplier.description: Scale factor for TB_Active_Mortality_Rate to give the mortality rate of active extrapulmonary individuals.

TB_Smear_Negative_Mortality_Multiplier.description: For individuals with smear-negative TB, scale factor to increase the mortality rate set by TB_Active_Mortality_Rate.

TB_Active_Presymptomatic_Infectivity_Mul.description: Scale factor for Base_Infectivity to give the infectiousness of active presymptomatic individuals.

TB_Presymptomatic_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active presymptomatic individuals progress to an active symptomatic state.

TB_Presymptomatic_Cure_Rate.description: The mean rate at which active presymptomatic individuals progress to a cured (uninfected) state

TB_Smear_Negative_Infectivity_Multiplier.description: Scale factor for Base_Infectivity to give the infectiousness of active smear-negative individuals.

TB_Drug_Efficacy_Multiplier_MDR.description: Scale factor for drug efficacy parameters (TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate) to give the efficacy of first-line drugs when given to individuals with MDR-TB.

TB_Drug_Efficacy_Multiplier_Failed.description: Scale factor for drug efficacy parameters (TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate) to give the efficacy of first-line drugs when given to individuals who have failed treatment.

TB_Drug_Efficacy_Multiplier_Relapsed.description: Scale factor for drug efficacy parameters (TB_Drug_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Drug_Cure_Rate) to give the efficacy of first-line drugs when given to individuals who have relapsed after treatment.

TB_MDR_Fitness_Multiplier.description: Scale factor for Base_Infectivity to give the infectiousness of MDR-TB strains.

TB_Relapsed_to_Active_Rate.description: The mean rate at which relapsed individuals progress to an active symptomatic state.

TB_Active_Period_Distribution.description: Distribution for duration of active disease. For all possible values, the mean is defined by total rate, which is the sum of TB_Inactivation_Rate and TB_Active_Mortality_Rate corrected for smear status. For GAUSSIAN_DURATION, an additional parameter TB_Active_Period_Std_Dev is used to provide a value for standard deviation.

TB_Active_Period_Std_Dev.description: When TB_Active_Period_Distribution is set to GAUSSIAN_DURATION, the value for standard deviation.

TB_CD4_Activation_Vector.description: The increased risk per time step of TB activation by CD4 strata defined in CD4_Strata_Activation.

CD4_Strata_Activation.description: An array of CD4 count thresholds by which to stratify the population.

Enable_Coinfection.description: Controls whether or not coinfection incidence is enabled.

CoInfection_Mortality_Rate_On_ART.description: The daily rate of death in excess to TB when coinfected with HIV on ART.

CoInfection_Mortality_Rate_Off_ART.description: The daily rate of death in excess to TB when coinfected with HIV off ART.

TB_CD4_Infectiousness.description: Relative multiplicative increase in TB Infectiousness due to HIV positivity/CD4 decline.

TB_CD4_Susceptibility.description: Relative increase in TB susceptibility due to HIV/CD4 decline.

TB_CD4_Primary_Progression.description: The proportion (multiplier) increase in primary progression with by CD4.

TB_CD4_Strata_Infectiousness_Susceptibil.description: The CD4 strata defining increases and decreases in TB infectiousness and susceptibility.

ART_Reactivation_Factor.description: Factor for ART reducing reactivation in HIV+.

TB_Enable_Exogenous.description: Controls whether or not exogenous reinfection of latent TB can occur.

Enable_Coinfection_Mortality.description: Controls whether or not TB/HIV coinfection mortality is enabled.

Age_Dependent_Biting_Risk_Type.description: The type of functional form for age-dependent biting risk.

Newborn_Biting_Risk_Multiplier.description: Scale factor that defines the y-intercept of the linear portion of the biting risk curve when Age_Dependent_Biting_Risk_Type is set to LINEAR.

Use_Defaults.description: Set to true (1) if you don't want to have to specify all params for event coordinators and interventions. Use at own risk.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to activate the event's event coordinator.

Nodeset_Config.description: An object that specifies in which nodes the interventions will be distributed.

Event_Coordinator_Config.description: An object that specifies how the event is handled by the simulation. It specifies which Event Coordinator class will handle the event, and then configures the coordinator.

Start_Year.description: The year to start using the assortivity weighting matrix.

Nodeset_Config.description: An object that specifies in which nodes the interventions will be distributed.

Event_Coordinator_Config.description: An object that specifies how the event is handled by the simulation. It specifies which Event Coordinator class will handle the event, and then configures the coordinator.

Distribution_Times.description: A vector of integers for simulation times at which distribution of events occurs in a CalendarEventCoordinator.

Distribution_Coverages.description: A vector of floats for the fraction of individuals that will receive this intervention in a CalendarEventCoordinator.

Intervention_Config.description: The nested JSON of the actual intervention to be distributed by this event coordinator.

Target_Age_Min.description: The lower end of ages targeted for an intervention, in years.

Target_Age_Max.description: The upper end of ages targeted for an intervention, in years.

Target_Gender.description: Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the IndividualProperty key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention.

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), the intervention is only distributed to individuals that began the simulation in the node (i.e. those that claim the node as their residence).

<key>.description: Node Property Key from demographics file.

<value>.description: Node Property Value from demographics file.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the NodeProperty key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that nodes must have to be targeted by the intervention.

Duration.description: The number of days for an event coordinator to be active before it expires.

Max_Distributed_Per_Day.description: The maximum number of interventions (such as vaccine doses) that can be distributed by health workers or clinics in a given day.

Waiting_Period.description: The number of days a person or node can be in the queue waiting to get the intervention from the community health worker (CHW).

Days_Between_Shipments.description: The number of days to wait before a clinic or health worker receives a new shipment of interventions (such as vaccine doses).

Amount_In_Shipment.description: The number of interventions (such as vaccine doses) that a health worker or clinic receives in a shipment.

Max_Stock.description: The maximum number of interventions (such as vaccine doses) that can be stored by a health worker or clinic.

Initial_Amount_Distribution_Type.description: The distribution type to set when initializing Initial_Amount.

Initial_Amount.description: The initial amount of stock of interventions (such as vaccine doses).

Initial_Amount_Min.description: The minimum amount of initial stock when Initial_Amount_Distribution_Type is set to UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION.

Initial_Amount_Max.description: The maximum amount of initial stock when Initial_Amount_Distribution_Type is set to UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION.

Initial_Amount_Mean.description: The average amount of initial stock when Initial_Amount_Distribution_Type is set to GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION.

Initial_Amount_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for the amount of initial stock when Initial_Amount_Distribution_Type is set to GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION.
