Incidence_Counter.description: List of JSON objects for specifying the conditions and parameters that must be met for an incidence to be counted.

Threshold_Type.description: Threshold type. Possible values are: * COUNT, * PERCENTAGE.

Threshold.description: The threshold value that triggers the specified action for the Event_To_Broadcast parameter.

Event_To_Broadcast.description: The action event to occur when the specified trigger value in the Threshold parameter is met. At least one action must be defined for Event_To_Broadcast.

Action_List.description: List (array) of JSON objects, including the values specified in the following parameters: * Threshold, * Event_To_Broadcast.

Responder.description: List of JSON objects for specifying the the threshold type and values and the actions to take when the specified conditions and parameters have been met, as configured in the Incidence_Counter parameter.

Start_Day.description: The day to start distributing the intervention.

End_Day.description: The day to stop distributing the intervention. No interventions are distributed on this day or going forward.

Num_Targeted.description: The number of individuals to target with the intervention.

Num_Targeted_Males.description: The number of male individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period.

Num_Targeted_Females.description: The number of female individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period.

Min.description: This parameter determines the minimum age, in years for individuals to be included in the targeted population. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Max.description: This parameter determines the maximum age, in years for individuals to be included in the targeted population. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Age_Ranges_Years.description: A list of age ranges that individuals must be in to qualify for an intervention. Each age range is a JSON object with a minimum and a maximum property.

End_Year.description: The year to stop distributing the intervention.

Target_Disease_State.description: A two-dimensional array of particular disease states. To qualify for the intervention, an individual must have only one of the targeted disease states. An individual must have all of the disease states in the inner array.

Target_Disease_State_Has_Intervention_Na.description: The name of the intervention to look for in an individual when using Has_Intervention or Not_have_Intervention in Target_Disease_State.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the diagnostic. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention (or a positive diagnosis, depending on the intervention class) distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option).

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: If the test is positive, this specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Only used if Event_Or_Config is set to Event.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. Only used when Event_Or_Config is set to Config.

TB_Drug_Resistance_Rate.description: The daily probability that an individual with drug-sensitive TB will acquire MDR-TB under drug treatment. Only individuals who return to the latent state or fail can acquire MDR-TB.

TB_Drug_Relapse_Rate.description: The daily probability of TB inactivation and subsequent relapse in an individual with drug-sensitive TB under drug treatment.

TB_Drug_Mortality_Rate.description: The daily rate at which treatment with an anti-TB drug causes death  in an individual with drug-sensitive TB.

Reduced_Transmit.description: The transmission reduction ratio, or the reduced infectiousness when an individual receives drugs.

Remaining_Doses.description: The remaining doses in an intervention; enter a negative number for unlimited doses.

Fraction_Defaulters.description: The fraction of individuals who will not finish their drug treatment.

Secondary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The secondary decay time constant of the durability profile.

Drug_CMax.description: The maximum drug concentration that can be used, and is in the same units as Drug_PKPD_C50.

Drug_Vd.description: The volume of drug distribution. This value is the ratio of the volume of the second compartment to the volume of the first compartment in a two-compartment model, and is dimensionless.

Drug_PKPD_C50.description: The concentration at which drug killing rates are half of the maximum. Must use the same units as Drug_Cmax.

Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: When Risk_Distribution_Type is set to GAUSSIAN_DURATION, the Gaussian_Std_Dev parameter defines the standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution for the active period. Negative values are truncated at zero.

Delay_Period_Mean.description: The mean time delay (in number of days), when Delay_Distribution is set to GAUSSIAN_DURATION.

Delay_Period_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution (in number of days) when Delay_Distribution is set to GAUSSIAN_DURATION.

Delay_Period_Scale.description: The scale parameter (lambda > 0) of the distribution (in days) when Delay_Distribution is set to WEIBULL_DURATION.

Delay_Period_Shape.description: The shape parameter (kappa > 0) of the distribution when Delay_Distribution is set to WEIBULL_DURATION.

Actual_IndividualIntervention_Configs.description: An array of nested interventions to be distributed at the end of a delay period, to covered fraction of the population.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to true (1) to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: A list of IndividualProperty key:value pairs that cause an intervention to be aborted. Generally used to control the flow of health care access. For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional IndividualProperty key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is distributed. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the diagnostic. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention (or a positive diagnosis, depending on the intervention class) distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option).

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: If an individual tests negative, this specifies an event that may trigger another intervention when the event occurs.

Defaulters_Event.description: Specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Event_Or_Config must be set to 'Event', and an individual did not return for test results.

Negative_Diagnosis_Config.description: If Event_Or_Config is set to Config, this is the intervention given out when there is a negative diagnosis.

Defaulters_Config.description: The intervention configuration given out when an individual did not return for test results when Event_Or_Config is set to 'Config'.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: If the test is positive, this specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Only used if Event_Or_Config is set to Event.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. Only used when Event_Or_Config is set to Config.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Values.description: An array of values to match the defined Times.

Threshold.description: If the individual's CD4 has ever been below the threshold specified, then the test will be positive.

If_Active_TB.description: If the individual's CD4 is not below the threshold in the Threshold table and the individual has TB (via their IndividualProperties), then the individual's CD4 will be compared to the CD4 value retrieved from the InterpolatedValueMap matrix based on the current year.

If_Pregnant.description: If the individual does not pass the diagnostic from the Threshold or TB matrices, and the individual is pregnant, then the individual's CD4 is compared to the value found in the InterpolatedValueMap matrix.

Individual_Property_Active_TB_Key.description: The IndividualProperty key ('HasActiveTB') used to determine whether the individual has TB.

Individual_Property_Active_TB_Value.description: The IndividualProperty value ('Yes') used to determine whether the individual has TB.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: If the test is positive, this specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Only used if Event_Or_Config is set to Event.

Adult_By_WHO_Stage.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which adults are eligible for ART.

Adult_By_TB.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which adults having active TB (via individual property Has_Active_TB) are eligible for ART.

Adult_By_Pregnant.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which pregnant adults are eligible for ART.

Child_Treat_Under_Age_In_Years_Threshold.description: Determines the age at which children are eligible for ART regardless of CD4, WHO stage, or other factors.

Child_By_WHO_Stage.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which children are eligible for ART.

Child_By_TB.description: Determines the WHO stage at or above which children having active TB (via individual property Has_Active_TB) are eligible for ART.

Individual_Property_Active_TB_Value.description: The IndividualProperty value ('Yes') used to determine whether the individual has TB.

Expiration_Period.description: A fixed time period, in days, after which the Broadcast_On_Expiration_Event occurs instead of the Broadcast_Event. Only applied if the Expiration_Period occurs earlier than the end of the delay period.

Coverage.description: The proportion of individuals who receive the DelayedIntervention that actually receive the configured interventions.

Delay_Distribution.description: The distribution of the time delay from when the intervention is distributed to when the individual actually receives the intervention.

Delay_Period.description: When Delay_Distribution is set to FIXED_DURATION, this will specify the time delay (in number of days). When Delay_Distribution is set to EXPONENTIAL_DURATION, this represents the exponential rate that describes the distribution of the time delay (in units of 1/days).

Delay_Period_Min.description: The minimum time delay (in number of days) when Delay_Distribution is set to UNIFORM_DURATION.

Delay_Period_Max.description: The maximum time delay (in number of days) when Delay_Distribution is set to UNIFORM_DURATION.

Delay_Period_Mean.description: The mean time delay (in number of days), when Delay_Distribution is set to GAUSSIAN_DURATION.

Delay_Period_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation of the Gaussian distribution (in number of days) when Delay_Distribution is set to GAUSSIAN_DURATION.

Delay_Period_Shape.description: The shape parameter (kappa > 0) of the distribution when Delay_Distribution is set to WEIBULL_DURATION.

Time_Varying_Constants.description: When Delay_Distribution is set to PIECEWISE_CONSTANT or PIECEWISE_LINEAR, this parameter maps simulation year to a delay period.

Broadcast_Event.description: The event that should occur at the end of the delay period.

Broadcast_On_Expiration_Event.description: If the delay intervention expires before arriving at the end of the delay period, this specifies the event that should occur.

When set to 1, interpolation between values in the Time_Value_Map is linear. The final value is held constant for all times after the last time specified in the Time_Value_Map.

Female_Multiplier.description: Allows for the probabilities in the Time_Value_Map to be different for males and females, by multiplying the female probabilities by a constant value.

Default_Value.description: The probability of positive diagnosis if the intervention is used before the earliest specified time in the Time_Value_Map.

Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention (or a positive diagnosis, depending on the intervention class) distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option).

Actual_IndividualIntervention_Event.description: The event of an actual intervention sought. Selects a class for the intervention and configures the parameters specific for that intervention class. See the list of available events for possible values.

Actual_IndividualIntervention_Config.description: The configuration of an actual intervention sought. Selects a class for the intervention and configures the parameters specific for that intervention class.

Single_Use.description: If set to true (1), the health-seeking behavior gets used once and discarded. If set to false (0), it remains indefinitely.

Age.description: An array of ages (in days). In IVCalendar, there is a list of actual interventions where the distribution is dependent on whether the individual's age matches the next date in the calendar.

Calendar.description: An array of ages, days and the probabilities of receiving the list of interventions at each age.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the diagnostic. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Treatment_Fraction_Negative_Diagnosis.description: The fraction of negative diagnoses that are treated.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention (or a positive diagnosis, depending on the intervention class) distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option).

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: If an individual tests negative, this specifies an event that may trigger another intervention when the event occurs.

Defaulters_Event.description: Specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Event_Or_Config must be set to 'Event', and an individual did not return for test results.

Negative_Diagnosis_Config.description: If Event_Or_Config is set to Config, this is the intervention given out when there is a negative diagnosis.

Defaulters_Config.description: The intervention configuration given out when an individual did not return for test results when Event_Or_Config is set to 'Config'.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: If the test is positive, this specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Only used if Event_Or_Config is set to Event.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. Only used when Event_Or_Config is set to Config.

Late.description: The right asymptote for the sigmoid trend over time. The Late value must be larger than the Early value.

MidYear.description: The time of the inflection point in the sigmoid trend over time.

Rate.description: The slope of the inflection point in the sigmoid trend over time. A Rate of 1 sets the slope to a 25% change in probability per year. Specify a negative Rate (e.g. -1) to achieve a negative sigmoid.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the diagnostic. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: The name of the event to broadcast when an individual is found to NOT be Post-Debut age.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention (or a positive diagnosis, depending on the intervention class) distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option).

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: If the test is positive, this specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Only used if Event_Or_Config is set to Event.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. Only used when Event_Or_Config is set to Config.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from test until diagnosis.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' assigned to the diagnostic. Setting Cost_To_Consumer to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention (or a positive diagnosis, depending on the intervention class) distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option).

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: If the test is positive, this specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Only used if Event_Or_Config is set to Event.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. Only used when Event_Or_Config is set to Config.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention, set to true (1) to prevent them from receiving another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: A list of IndividualProperty key:value pairs that cause an intervention to be aborted. Generally used to control the flow of health care access. For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional IndividualProperty key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is distributed. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways.

Habitat_Target.description: The larval habitat type targeted for habitat reduction.

Spray_Kill_Target.description: The gender kill-target of vector control interventions.

Killing_Config.description: The configuration of killing efficacy and waning for space spaying.

Reduction_Config.description: The configuration of larval habitat reduction and waning for space spraying.

Latency_Multiplier.description: Multiplier of clearance/inactivation if latent TB on drug treatment.

Active_Multiplier.description: Multiplier of clearance/inactivation if active TB on drug treatment.

Primary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The primary decay time constant (in days) of the decay profile.

Remaining_Doses.description: The remaining doses in an intervention; enter a negative number for unlimited doses.

Dose_Interval.description: The interval between doses, in days.

Fraction_Defaulters.description: The fraction of individuals who will not finish their drug treatment.

Secondary_Decay_Time_Constant.description: The secondary decay time constant of the durability profile.

Drug_CMax.description: The maximum drug concentration that can be used, and is in the same units as Drug_PKPD_C50.

Drug_Vd.description: The volume of drug distribution. This value is the ratio of the volume of the second compartment to the volume of the first compartment in a two-compartment model, and is dimensionless.

Drug_PKPD_C50.description: The concentration at which drug killing rates are half of the maximum. Must use the same units as Drug_Cmax.

Killing_Config.description: The configuration of the rate at which mosquitoes die, conditional on a successfully blocked feed; decays over time.

Blocking_Config.description: Configures the rate of blocking for indoor mosquito feeds on individuals with an ITN; decays over time.

Usage_Config_List.description: The list of WaningEffects whose effects are multiplied together to get the usage effect.

Expiration_Distribution_Type.description: The type of distribution to use when calculating the time to discard a bed net.

Expiration_Period.description: The distribution period for when a bed net expires.

Expiration_Period_Min.description: The minimum duration of use for a bed net.

Expiration_Period_Max.description: The maximum duration of use for a bed net.

Expiration_Period_Mean.description: The mean of the duration of use for a bed net.

Expiration_Period_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for the duration of use for a bed net.

Expiration_Period_1.description: The decay length of the first time-scale.

Expiration_Period_2.description: The decay length of the second time-scale.

Expiration_Percentage_Period_1.description: The percentage of draws where the first time-scale is used.

Received_Event.description: This parameter broadcasts when a new net is received, either the first net or a replacement net.

Using_Event.description: This parameter broadcasts each time step in which a bed net is used.

Discard_Event.description: The event that is broadcast when an individual discards their bed net, either by replacing an existing net or due to the expiration timer.

Node_List.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs in which this event will occur.

Vertices.description: Comma-separated list of latitude/longitude points that bound a polygon.

Polygon_Format.description: The type of polygon to create.

Box_Duration.description: Box duration of effect in days.

Initial_Effect.description: Initial strength of the effect. The effect decays over time.

Box_Duration.description: Box duration of effect in days.

Decay_Time_Constant.description: The exponential decay length, in days.

Initial_Effect.description: Initial strength of the effect. The effect decays over time.

Add_Effects.description: The Add_Effects parameter allows you to combine multiple effects from the waning effect classes. If set to true (1), then the waning effect values from the different waning effect objects are added together. If set to false (0), the waning effect values are multiplied. The resulting waning effect value must be greater than 1.

Expires_When_All_Expire.description: If set to true (1), then all of the effects, as specified in the Effect_List parameter, must expire for the efficacy of the intervention to expire. If set to false (0), then the efficacy of the intervention will expire as soon as one of the parameters expires.

Effect_List.description: A list of nested JSON objects to indicate how the intervention efficacy wanes over time.

Expire_At_Durability_Map_End.description: Set to 1 to let the intervention expire when the end of the map is reached.
